basics.name: Sean Meissimilly
basics.label: Full Stack Developer
basics.summary: Full Stack Developer with experience in creating modern and responsive web applications. Passionate about cutting-edge technologies and efficient solution development.

work.name: Alsoft Pro SRL

highlights: Led the redesign of the main interface, improving user experience by 40%
Implemented new features that increased user engagement by 25%

Optimized SQL queries and PostgreSQL database performance
Collaborated on architecture and feature design

achievements: Implemented a real-time notification system using WebSockets

work.name: Centro Cimex de Capacitación
work.summary: Delivered comprehensive IT training programs including Excel at various levels, computer basics, and office productivity tools. Designed and implemented technical solutions to enhance the learning experience.
highlights: Developed and deployed a custom web application using Java Server Pages (JSP) that remains in active use, improving administrative efficiency by 40%
Successfully implemented and configured Moodle learning management system on Apache Tomcat server, supporting digital education initiatives
Created and delivered specialized Excel training programs that improved students' productivity by an average of 60%
Provided technical support and training for office productivity tools to staff and students
responsibilities: Planned and delivered IT training sessions for diverse skill levels
Developed course materials and practical exercises for Excel and office tools
Installed, configured, and maintained Moodle LMS on Apache server
Developed and deployed a JSP-based application on Apache Tomcat
Provided technical support for classroom hardware and software
Customized JSP-based applications to meet administrative needs
achievements: Improved administrative efficiency by 40% through custom JSP application on Apache Tomcat
Enhanced digital learning adoption by implementing Moodle LMS on Apache
Increased student productivity by 60% with specialized Excel training

work.name: Datacimex
work.summary: Specialized in SQL Server report development, system enhancements, and providing technical support for Java and .NET web applications.
highlights: Designed, developed, and optimized SQL Server reports to support business intelligence and decision-making processes
Provided technical support and maintenance for both Java and .NET enterprise web applications
Enhanced existing web applications by implementing new features and functionalities using C# and Java
Reduced system downtime by 25% through proactive troubleshooting and issue resolution
Collaborated with cross-functional teams to identify and resolve software issues, improving overall system reliability
responsibilities: Developed and optimized SQL Server reports for business intelligence
Maintained and enhanced Java and .NET enterprise applications
Implemented new features using C# and Java
Performed database optimization and query tuning
Provided technical support and troubleshooting for end-users
achievements: Reduced system downtime by 25% through proactive maintenance
Improved reporting efficiency with optimized SQL Server queries
Enhanced application functionality with new feature implementations

education.institution: Universidad Tecnológica de La Habana José Antonio Echeverría (CUJAE)

projects.name: Alinfo - Virtual Food Engineering Repository (Frontend)
projects.description: Frontend for a virtual repository of food engineering resources, built with modern React and state management.
highlights: Developed a responsive user interface with React and Tailwind CSS
Implemented state management using Redux Toolkit for efficient data flow
Created reusable UI components for consistent design across the application
Integrated with Django REST API for data fetching and state synchronization

projects.name: Alinfo - Virtual Food Engineering Repository (Backend)
projects.description: RESTful API backend for the Alinfo platform, providing data management for food engineering resources.
highlights: Designed and implemented RESTful API endpoints using Django REST Framework
Set up PostgreSQL database for reliable data storage and retrieval
Implemented authentication and authorization for secure access to resources
Optimized database queries for improved performance

projects.name: Hitori Puzzle Game
projects.description: A fully functional C# implementation of the classic Hitori puzzle with a Windows Forms interface. The game is ready to play - simply download the repository and run the executable.
highlights: Developed a complete, production-ready game with intuitive Windows Forms interface
Easy to install and play - no additional setup required
Features include automatic puzzle generation, rule validation, and responsive UI
Includes executable file for immediate play (Hitori\Parte Visual\bin\Debug\Parte Visual.exe)
projects.quickStart:
1. Clone the repository
2. Navigate to Hitori-main\Parte Visual\bin\Debug
3. Run 'Parte Visual.exe' to start playing

projects.name: Gestion-Acciones
projects.description: A comprehensive web application for managing corporate training programs and employee development initiatives. This system streamlines the organization and tracking of training activities across the enterprise.
highlights: Developed a complete training management solution using Java Server Pages (JSP) and Java Servlets
Designed and implemented a responsive user interface with Bootstrap 5 for optimal user experience
Integrated with MariaDB for reliable data storage and retrieval
Deployed on Apache Tomcat 8.5 server ensuring stable performance
Implemented user authentication and role-based access control
Created reporting features for tracking training completion and effectiveness
